intro: Epilobium spicatum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy. Its most distinctive characteristic is its clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The flowers are borne on elongated inflorescences and are attractive to pollinators like bees and butterflies.
